meanings.definition: To express an intention to harm or punish
meanings.sent1: He threatened to tell the teacher about the cheating.
meanings.sent2: The bully threatened to take the other kid's lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel threatened to steal all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds threatened to unleash a storm upon the town.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's fiery breath threatened to engulf the entire village.

meanings.definition: To be a source of danger or harm to
meanings.sent1: The sharp knife threatened to cut his finger.
meanings.sent2: The unstable bridge threatened to collapse under the weight of the truck.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat threatened to knock over the vase on the table.
meanings.sent4: The growing wildfire threatened to engulf the entire forest.
meanings.sent5: The rising floodwaters threatened to submerge the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To give warning of something unpleasant or violent
meanings.sent2: The doctor's serious tone threatened bad news.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunder threatened to wake up the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence threatened an imminent attack.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind threatened to blow away everything in its path.
